replies.body:
Them "Diamont Support main"

Me "You seem to lose almost all matches where you´re not Lulu or Janna. 
        Maybe you are just bad?"

Them "Lmao, those are my best champs and im Diamond so shush"

Me:
 https://imgur.com/uTwLNMo
There's someone down below that fits that description just perfectly :^)

> [{quoted}](name=Tokogawaruf,realm=EUW,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=NkP5Ar8l,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2018-04-29T18:05:24.088+0000)
>
> Them "Diamont Support main"
> 
> Me "You seem to lose almost all matches where you´re not Lulu or Janna. 
>         Maybe you are just bad?"
> 
> Them "Lmao, those are my best champs and im Diamond so shush"
> 
> Me:
>  https://imgur.com/uTwLNMo

This argument could be made for literally any other role/position tho.
80% of diamonds 1 role and most of said 80% are 1tricks, lol.

You know what's weird? I don't even feel offended. I played Janna on Tournament- level a few years ago and i have 3500+ games on her. Yet i never feel offended with these posts. Why? Because i've never met another Janna player who doesn't hide behind their Adc all game, making AP-heavy items so they can spam E like some braindead point & click bot.

Those players only make me cringe in-game. They're disgusting, and have given all Janna players a bad name because most of them deserve it due to never exploiting all the hidden skill expression possible.

By the way, the term "e-girls" is pretty stupid imo. It makes you look like some 14 year old who's salty over not having a girlfriend or something. Seriously.

> [{quoted}](name=LightTrack,realm=EUW,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=NkP5Ar8l,comment-id=0006,timestamp=2018-04-29T22:08:43.503+0000)
> By the way, the term "e-girls" is pretty stupid imo. It makes you look like some 14 year old who's salty over not having a girlfriend or something. Seriously.

Hey I am just using whatever gets in the upvotes :)
Okay, but this isn't Buzzfeed. At least make it look like you're trying to be constructive.
lol i woulda believed you weren't offended till you started complaining lollo
But i'm not. I'm merely stating that it's a dumb term that has nothing to do with Janna exclusively. It just makes an author of a post look like some pubescent kid more than it should.

>By the way, the term "e-girls" is pretty stupid imo. It makes you look like some 14 year old who's salty over not having a girlfriend or something. Seriously.

Yeah, and playing Janna to Diamond makes Janna players look like e-girls. 

Insulting him for his behavior doesn't change his right to insult other people for their behavior.

I don't remember linking Janna to the term. It's a completely separate thing and all i did was say that i feel as if only immature kids use that term to sound cooler. That's not an insult as i didn't mention OP anywhere in it. If you're butthurt cuz it relates to you then maybe i've got a point.
How did you not mention OP? You said "it makes YOU look like a 14 year old who's salty over not having a girlfriend." That is insulting him.

He used the royal you, instead of the specific you.

"You" meaning "not me" ("Me" in this case referring to the user known as LightTrack, from the EUW region, not to the person writing this comment).

Please don't try to argue semantics when the real meaning is fairly clear. If someone who doesn't speak it as a native knows how to differentiate the two, so can you.
The real meaning was _not_ fairly clear. He was talking to someone specifically about a specific thing that person said.
As an adc main I see a LOT of jannas who play aggro with her in the laning phase.

Doesn't matter. She's highly forgiving thanks to her disengage. The hidden skill expression i'm talking about is perfect positioning, psyche aggro, orbwalking, animation cancelling inbetween attacks, certain tricks with abilities although there exist only 4 of which i know, damage trading strategies in-lane, etc.

It's more than just flying around, throwing Ws and Es. Anybody can do that. You have to be able to manipulate your enemies and sometimes your team into following your lead.

"Hidden" skill expression...?

That's... not a thing on her. It's incredibly straightforward. The extent of her skill expression is timing, positioning, and her Q, her only skillshot.

You put the E on the right player at the right time and you W the right enemy where it'll matter (like not blowing it on a Fizz who's going to leap to your carry anyway instead of hitting the Tahm Kench; slowing immobility over mobility). You use your ult appropriately and you position correctly. If you find this difficult to accomplish on Janna or think that it's a "challenge", I have to apologize and say that you're probably going to fall flat on your face with every other champion because no other champion carries the same amount of safety and utility on such a simple and easy kit. Not to mention other champs already have to worry about positioning and timing on top of actually hitting their shit.

#Incoming controversial statement I guess, maybe not so much since it should be pretty obvious by now:

Playing **Sona** is harder than playing Janna. If you were a Sona player and argued that people didn't appreciate her hidden skill expression, then I would say you might actually have something since Sona's passive requires her to stack it as well as finish her combo with the key she wants to put to use - either increased damage, lowering enemy damage output, or slowing the enemy. You choose the wrong one at the wrong time and you can end up getting somebody killed. _That's_ something to actually worry about. This is on top of Sona having next to no self-peel and being one of the squishiest champions in the game.

Flashing and pressing R once to knock an enemy champion 900 feet away from their partners because you have one of the most unfair ults in the game as far as counter-engage and sustain goes doesn't quite carry the same worry about it when you have to do nothing but press the button and watch the results go off.

> [{quoted}](name=Toxic Control,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=NkP5Ar8l,comment-id=00060005,timestamp=2018-04-30T10:55:57.827+0000)
>
> "Hidden" skill expression...?
> 
> That's... not a thing on her. It's incredibly straightforward. The extent of her skill expression is timing, positioning, and her Q, her only skillshot.

Isn't that enough?.. She's an enchanter support, not some assassin with ton of different mechanics. From all enchanter supports she probably has the highest skill cap, and also don't forget her R, which can be used in a ton of ways, just like her Q. Timing and positioning aren't that straightforward either.

Did I not mention her R later in the post? Guess I didn't even though I did. Or maybe you just didn't read that part because, I mean, reading just one part of an argument obviously means you get the whole thing, right?

So to reiterate the entire rest of the post: Janna requires nothing that any other champion doesn't already require, and in fact requires far less. Her R is a literal button press and while it can be "used in a ton of ways", not only have all those ways been displayed in the well over 100 games of LCS that Janna makes her appearance in, **it's not mechanically difficult to pull off** - it's actually one of the easiest things to accomplish because, again, press the button, watch the results.

Now this could be considered to require more mastery if Janna didn't, say... have a passive on her W that actually makes her one of the fastest moving champions in the game which allows her to position herself with such absolute ease that it's quite literally one of the main reasons she's picked so often and why she continues to stay relevant, one of the other reasons being that _she isn't fallible_ - she is a reliable constant since she will practically always be played to her full potential just because she's so simple and has all the tools she'll ever require at her full disposal.

The fact you say she has one of the highest skill caps of all enchanters is absolutely baffling, honestly. Like, what...? You realize she has had the highest winrate _and_ the highest playrate out of all enchanters since forever always, right? So by your logic, if she's the "highest skill cap enchanter", then she must be disgustingly overpowered and overtuned right now. Guess we better nerf her to oblivion, we have your approval! Because shit, if Azir had the same winrates Janna has - and he's the highest skillcap mid-laner tied with A.Sol - he'd be deleted from the game and re-added with a new kit. That is what you are basically telling me.

> The fact you say she has one of the highest skill caps of all enchanters is absolutely baffling, honestly. Like, what...? You realize she has had the highest winrate _and_ the highest playrate out of all enchanters since forever always, right? So by your logic, if she's the "highest skill cap enchanter", then she must be disgustingly overpowered and overtuned right now. Guess we better nerf her to oblivion, we have your approval! Because shit, if Azir had the same winrates Janna has - and he's the highest skillcap mid-laner tied with A.Sol - he'd be deleted from the game and re-added with a new kit. That is what you are basically telling me.

Well, maybe it is because Janna's skill **floor** is a lot lower than Azir's. As someone in comments said, there are a lot of Janna players who just stack ap items and spam E behind their adcs and that's it. Any player can pick her up when autofilled - but Azir requires training. Still doesn't mean she can't be mastered and do actual plays which autofilled janna player wouldn't. And getting good at those plays is her hidden skill expression.

I am in no way going to dissect my own playstyle for your sake but i can confidently say that you've never seen an actual good Janna player play.

Can't say i blame you as ( as egocentric as it sounds) i've never met a Janna player that plays like me either. Not a single one. There have been aggressive ones but they all fall flat somewhere and do their own stupid AP builds or make dumb positioning decisions that reek of overarrogance.

I, personally don't build AP. Never. Well except for Shurelya's Reverie i guess but i don't really have a choice anymore as Talisman never gave AP. Regardless, i have 6 active items to manage, all with different effects if you count in Sightstone and Lens. The shield is not very easy to land when you're moving at Mach 6 and trying to keep track of the enemy, including your Tornado being a viable option if someone Dives in.

Ok, i don't want to stretch the reply too long but there are things like trading in-lane with basic attacks via animation cancelling and orbwalking properly, things like doing an Insec Flash + Q + R to get someone to fly towards your team or putting your tornado in reverse so the enemies walk around it but won't expect it to go the other way. Or actually, just deceiving them into going the full tornado's path by using deceptive movement while casting. Similarily to Thresh.

I've never had any real counters in the opposing lane EXCEPT for Brand in all these years because of his absurd range and cc implementation.

And since you'd assume i'd fall flat or sth, i don't main Janna anymore. I mained her for 3 years straight until the meta twisted her into an afk-carry which sickened me to the core. Not many opportunities for strategy in the game anymore in general so i left it for Jungle and Adc. I only play her occasionally and not much has changed in terms of gameplay, aside from some number tweaks that i don't really approve of.

So... you literally said exactly what I said made Janna simple minded back at me but in more detail in order to not "stretch the reply too long".

Janna has no skill expression that any champion already has. Orbwalking and animation canceling isn't exclusive to her, nor are health and mana conservation. None of that is exclusive to Janna. What is exclusive to Janna and other enchanters are their simplicity, with Janna riding the highest horse of "easiest in the game".

She is, without comparison, the safest champion in the game, having the lowest death count of any enchanter support and the lowest death count of any champion with 10%+ playrates - to translate what that means, _even people who don't main Janna die excessively less than other champions on average, since we are to assume that 10% of the playerbase does not actually main Janna_. Her ult is - as I said - completely simple to use as it's a bloody button press on Janna's model - so the flash/ult move isn't actually as impressive as the shoutcasters always made it out to be. It is quite literally: point cursor at position, flash to position, press button. If you fuck up that sequence then you should really review what games you play because League probably isn't for you. Tying Q into the combo isn't especially hard when it's one of the widest skillshots in the game and can be cast immediately on command by double-tapping. Barrel stuff the poor sucker and do the combo - there ya go.

You'll also notice that I literally pointed out that combo in the last paragraph, so you have quite literally just admitted that the extent of Janna's "hidden skillcap" is non-existent since it's not hidden - we've seen it. 8 years and everyone has seen it. There's no new depths to plunder and no new mysteries to find. We've seen basically everything there is to Lee Sin's kit, and his is multitudes more complex than Janna's - you really think Janna's special and has some hidden potential?

She doesn't. She's the simplest most braindead champion in the game. You can stretch that braindead play to encompass some _general_ amount of League skill, like orb-walking (again, not exclusive to Janna) or poking or conservation of resources or dropping actives like a mother-fucker, but there's nothing hidden about any of that. It's out in the open. Try predicting enemy movements with Xerath, or faking people out with Ekko, or using Vi to initiate before flashing over a wall when the enemy pops all their shit on an empty spot, then Q back into the fight once your team's followed up. Those are some good plays that can fall flat if you haven't a clue what you're doing.

Janna's face-value. You will always get what you see, and all you need to do is know what the kit does. No further effort required.

> So... you literally said exactly what I said made Janna simple minded back at me but in more detail in order to not "stretch the reply too long".

No i didn't. And i compressed what i was trying to say a lot to avoid turning it into an in-depth guide.

> Orbwalking and animation canceling isn't exclusive to her, nor are health and mana conservation

I...never said that? I only said she has that in her kit? And given how i've hinted at nobody playing at my level, i have only seen 2 Janna players orbwalk and animation cancel at the same time. They both were hyper-aggressive.

> She is, without comparison, the safest champion in the game

Ok, what is your point here? I never denied that, i said she has a lot of hidden skill expression in her kit. When did i say she was not easy? She is without a doubt the easiest, most user-friendly Support in the game because of how much flat power is funneled into the nature of her abilities and her E. No shit, Sherlock!

> flash/ult move isn't actually as impressive as the shoutcasters always made it out to be.

Extremely situational and it's highly risk-heavy as they may react faster than you and get out of the way, the speed relative to them may change and you may have to be much closer to secure it, giving them a heads up. You're discrediting all the variables of the game itself in order to make it look simple. Sure, in principle it's pretty simple. But unless you're playing against Gold players or something, they'll recognize what you're trying to do. Also, it's usually best to make sure it's worth the expense as i haven't gotten a kill simply by successfully pushing someone into an ally, as they can get outmatched/outdamaged and screw it up themselves, even with me present.

That's like saying playing an FPS game is easy as all it requires is pointing and shooting at an enemy model.

> Tying Q into the combo isn't especially hard when it's one of the widest skillshots in the game and can be cast immediately on command by double-tapping. 

First, with the recent changes to the tornado speed, it's freakishly hard as it moves very slowly in comparison to how it used to. And i don't see what does width have anything to do with this when it was nearly cut in half to match the visuals 2 seasons ago.

Secondly, i use Normal Cast. It takes quite a bit of coordination so i wouldn't fuck up the literal mechanical input.

> You'll also notice that I literally pointed out that combo in the last paragraph, so you have quite literally just admitted that the extent of Janna's "hidden skillcap" is non-existent since it's not hidden - we've seen it.

Yet i've rarely seen it across ranks ranging from Silver to Tournament - Challenger. I don't watch Esports so that's entirely irrelevant. It's hidden because it's not obvious for everyone, obviously. Are you this dense just for the sake of an argument?

And the rest is you just arrogantly trying to force a self-conflicting idea on me that doesn't hold any merit to it. Not to mention you're separating general skill from champion skill. All champions have personal animation lengths,movement speeds, ability quirks and unique passives that you're completely disregarding as "general skill".  You're simply wrong and i know that as i'm a living testament to that. When i said i've **never** met another player that plays Janna like me, what do you think i was trying to say? That the sky is actually purple?

You're thinking that i was saying her kit is something "toootally different" when it's not. I don't know why you pulled that side of the argument out of nowhere when i was simply describing how you can be innovative with it and how almost noone i've met has used her to her fullest potential. Like what's your point? Trying to convince me that i'm playing an easy champion? No shit! Am i playing her the easy way? Obviously, fucking not.

Maybe you just fail to aknowledge that because it'll hurt your pride or something, i don't know. Truth is, i don't care. No Janna player has been truly proficient on her from my point of view, and as long as people opt to play her like she's a tutorial champion or until she gets some kind of a rework, it'll remain that way. Thanks for reading.

> [{quoted}](name=LightTrack,realm=EUW,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=NkP5Ar8l,comment-id=00060005000100000000,timestamp=2018-04-30T19:07:34.956+0000)
> Ok, what is your point here? I never denied that, i said she has a lot of hidden skill expression in her kit. When did i say she was not easy? **She is without a doubt the easiest, most user-friendly Support in the game because of how much flat power is funneled into the nature of her abilities and her E. No shit, Sherlock!**
> 

I mean, I really don't have to say anything else now, do I? Her skill-ceiling is next to dinosaur bones, you admit it and know it. You also admitted that orbwalking nor animation canceling are exclusive to Janna's kit, you also admit that Janna really doesn't take any more effort or skill to play than any other champion that has those utilities in their kit.

I'll still grab this portion:

> Extremely situational and it's highly risk-heavy as they may react faster than you and get out of the way, the speed relative to them may change and you may have to be much closer to secure it, giving them a heads up. You're discrediting all the variables of the game itself in order to make it look simple. **Sure, in principle it's pretty simple.**

In _practice_ it's also simple. Having a risk/reward system isn't _new_ and it doesn't necessarily take skill to cash in on it. Those two aren't inherently inclusive to each other - you can have a braindead, easy thing be a high-risk move. Flashing over a wall into dragon isn't exactly hard to do, and doing it for a steal puts a risk/reward - does it make it harder to pull of? Not really. Flash is immediate and smite is a set number, so given two junglers hitting smite at the best time at the same level, it's going to be more of a coin flip than anything.

If you're having trouble following this argument like all the other ones, I'm saying flashing and hitting one button that will always 100% do the same action every time isn't skill expression. It's just timing - you understand timing, you understand when to hit the button. All other factors are automatically worked out for you. That is not something that makes you a better Janna player - that's just better play in general. Understanding timing is largely macro-play versus micro-play. Now rationing out your cooldowns, that can be tied to the champion you play, but again, Janna's not hard to do that with nor are there usually worries tied to it besides giving up your bonus MS when using your W - not that you don't then have 5 other things to protect yourself in the meantime so like it really matters anyway.

> Also, it's usually best to make sure it's worth the expense as i haven't gotten a kill simply by successfully pushing someone into an ally, as they can get outmatched/outdamaged and screw it up themselves, even with me present.

This also isn't skill expression on your part as you've just completed your part. Janna doesn't outplay - Janna gets outplayed. Since Janna will consistently perform the same exact way given the way her abilities function, it's generally on the enemy player to instead outplay and counter Janna as opposed to Janna having to outsmart the enemy since Janna doesn't really have a ton of tools to "outsmart" them with so much as just blatantly stat-check them (not unlike Nasus or Singed). You pressed R and put them in your team. Your job's done besides shielding and Q'ing and other crap. Maybe you die. Whatever. This still isn't skill expression - this is basic game calculation. Your Nautilus is doing the same exact thing trying to figure out if he can lock down the enemy ADC long enough for his team to kill it or if he'll end up getting nuked to shit. Difference being Nauty-dog also has to worry about hitting his goddamn Q on the right person to begin with and how he's even going to get to the ADC all the way back there.

These are basic calculations. None of this is a "Janna player" thing. It's a macro-level - throw a Diamond player that understands basic game mechanics and they'll perform just fine on Janna without really having to worry about much else because _they understand these **game mechanics**_.

And the last three paragraphs are you spouting off on some tangent that's so misguided I kind of laughed. That's quite a lot of assumptions you've made. Sure, my argument definitely wasn't about how "hidden skill expression" is all but absent on Janna due to the fact that she is as complex as an amoeba's neural functions and that you're so far up your own backside that you don't realize that any ol' schlub can play Janna to her maximum extent due to the fact that yes, her power is so frontloaded into her E/R/W-passive that she hasn't had to worry about making the "big plays" for 2 bloody seasons and so the reason you don't see anybody take those risks is because they're 100% unnecessary when Janna is able to just stat check everyone nowadays. No, definitely not the point I was making. I was trying to attack your sense of pride because, I mean, mine's just so fragile I guess. 'S why I started this whole thread about how somebody saying Janna's as braindead as a guppy doesn't offend me because I'm such a testament to how truly great a Janna player can be and oh look at me I'm a paragon of Janna play - oh that wasn't me. I think I got my side mixed up somewhere in the middle here.

What was I arguing again? Was it that Janna is a paint-by-numbers champion that really only requires basic game knowledge and awareness of her kit with no hidden mechanics whatsoever? I think that's what it was, and I think I accomplished that pretty swell.

> you also admit that Janna really doesn't take any more effort or skill to play than any other champion that has those utilities in their kit.

Um, not for me since i think i've said about 2 or 3 times that i maximize the input required to harness all her hidden skill expression. She's not easy by a longshot the way i play her. I think you're completely missing my point a 2nd time now.

> In practice it's also simple. Having a risk/reward system isn't new and it doesn't necessarily take skill to cash in on it. Those two aren't inherently inclusive to each other - you can have a braindead, easy thing be a high-risk move. Flashing over a wall into dragon isn't exactly hard to do, and doing it for a steal puts a risk/reward - does it make it harder to pull of? Not really. Flash is immediate and smite is a set number, so given two junglers hitting smite at the best time at the same level, it's going to be more of a coin flip than anything.


From here, the entire wall of text onwards is a pointless attempt to convince me otherwise when i know a thousand times better than you what goes on in practice from **experience**. You're not a Janna player, you'll never even understand what i'm talking about here because you don't really care. Stop trying, because you're nowhere near credible. You're essentially repeating yourself here and as i was saying, not going to turn this into an in-depth guide just for your sake.

Your entire argument is completely off the rails apparently. I don't know what you're trying to prove here. I know that Janna players generally take the easy route and go for AP heavy builds. I showed clear disgust towards them as there are a multitude of things i do differently, simultaneously in real time that they never have the balls to but it seems to me that you're trying to downplay that for...what? Winning an argument? You played Tahm Top, do you really want to lecture me about what's easy or not?

I mean, sheesh, I hate to be dismissive but... Yeah, I'm just going to be dismissive. You're way too high up on that horse of yours. Can't help but just shake my head and laugh.

You know what, all right. You've earned the right to gorge your ego on your Janna play. All the power to you. I concede.

> [{quoted}](name=Toxic Control,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=NkP5Ar8l,comment-id=00060005,timestamp=2018-04-30T10:55:57.827+0000)
>
> "Hidden" skill expression...?
> 
> That's... not a thing on her. It's incredibly straightforward. The extent of her skill expression is timing, positioning, and her Q, her only skillshot.
> 
> You put the E on the right player at the right time and you W the right enemy where it'll matter (like not blowing it on a Fizz who's going to leap to your carry anyway instead of hitting the Tahm Kench; slowing immobility over mobility). You use your ult appropriately and you position correctly. If you find this difficult to accomplish on Janna or think that it's a "challenge", I have to apologize and say that you're probably going to fall flat on your face with every other champion because no other champion carries the same amount of safety and utility on such a simple and easy kit. Not to mention other champs already have to worry about positioning and timing on top of actually hitting their shit.
> 
> #Incoming controversial statement I guess, maybe not so much since it should be pretty obvious by now:
> 
> Playing **Sona** is harder than playing Janna. If you were a Sona player and argued that people didn't appreciate her hidden skill expression, then I would say you might actually have something since Sona's passive requires her to stack it as well as finish her combo with the key she wants to put to use - either increased damage, lowering enemy damage output, or slowing the enemy. You choose the wrong one at the wrong time and you can end up getting somebody killed. _That's_ something to actually worry about. This is on top of Sona having next to no self-peel and being one of the squishiest champions in the game.
> 
> Flashing and pressing R once to knock an enemy champion 900 feet away from their partners because you have one of the most unfair ults in the game as far as counter-engage and sustain goes doesn't quite carry the same worry about it when you have to do nothing but press the button and watch the results go off.

While i generally agree, you are greatly overselling the importance of managing Sonas passive. Generally speaking, it is far and away from the thing that will make or break Sona's success cases. Her stats are,

Sona is also far easier to play than janna. Janna is just a stronger champion.

You talk about just pressing buttons and watching the result, when that is by and large the perfect description of the bulk of sona's gameplay. You just press buttons next to people.

You also claim she has no self peel when she has her passive slow, ult and E movespeed to work with.

She also does the most damage of any enchanter of game.


While i agree with your point to an extent, cant say i do as a whole.

Sona is generally harder to maximize your potential on with her as a champ as opposed to Janna, since Sona has far more emphasis on her positioning and, while her passive won't usually be the breaking point for her, the point was that that's more of a hidden power that Sona has than anything at all in Janna's kit. Both are by far the easiest champions in the game without comparison, and were this an earlier season than I'd say Sona certainly would be the easiest by far - since Sona's reworking, Sona does have to play to her ability auras a lot more and micro-manage where she needs to be a lot more often than Janna, who can basically slap a tornado and shield somewhere away from her and just kind of focus on being in a place where her ult will do the most disruption possible come teamfights.

Is Sona hard? Fuck no. Statement was really just that Janna's so braindead easy that Sona is difficult by comparison, which is really saying something about Janna.

On the terms of "self-peel", Sona can do wonders to keep herself positioned right, but getting hit by hard CC generally means that she won't be escaping even if her ult's up since stuns are reduceable CC and hers isn't even particularly long by comparison to a lot of champs - 1.5 seconds isn't exactly something that'll get you out of a shitstorm on short notice, while Janna's massive knockback on her ult tied in with her perma-speed boost on her W will usually be more than enough to get her to safety on more than one occasion.
do you have you eyes closed the whole time? there's metric shit tons of janna players being disgustingly over tuned *in front of*  their adcs too

I stated how Janna players make me cringe with their misplaced timings and positioning by generalizing how they never exploit hidden skill expression.

What's your point?
I could main Janna to get out of silver but I have morals.

> [{quoted}](name=SaltLord451,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=NkP5Ar8l,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2018-04-29T18:30:47.467+0000)
>
> I could main Janna to get out of silver but I have morals.

just try it lol
#notevenonce
You would aslo have silver ADCs and that would be the catch

Community:Players are calling support a role for noobs do something riot.
Riot:Don't worry i got this
Riot://Keeps janna at 53% winrate for 2 years
Patrick we did it we saved the city.

> [{quoted}](name=Rainfall,realm=EUNE,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=NkP5Ar8l,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2018-04-29T19:27:53.886+0000)
>
> Community:Players are calling support a role for noobs do something riot.
> Riot:Don't worry i got this
> Riot://Keeps janna at 53% winrate for 2 years
> Patrick we did it we saved the city.

What? Last time i checked the community has been saying that you cant carry as support for 8 seasons.
Why do Janna players have to be "e-girls"?
I'm a guy. I've always preferred the enchanter class of supports. The e-girl insults are annoying.

It's comedy, you shouldn't really take such offense to it. The term "e-girl" is used when a girl who plays video games acts like they either know a lot, but clearly don't, or try to get a few 'advantages' for themselves (like getting the RL in WoW to get them extra loot from other people that actually need it).
Janna is simply a perfect example of a champion designed around being easy and appealing to female fantasy. New players can attain high ranks with her, since she's reliant on her teammates to carry her, and as such has the title of being the e-girl's champion.
There's an equal term for males as well, it's not exclusive to female nor does it apply to all of them. If you're a great support player and have earned your rank, then I'm sure nobody will actually judge you.
